item.title: Primal Carnage: Evolution now available
item.content:encoded:
• PS4

Hunt humans, slay dinosaurs.

Dinosaur first-person shooter Primal Carnage: Evolution is now available for PlayStation 4 via PlayStation Store for $19.99, Circle 5 Publishing and developer Circle 5 Studios announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Circle 5 Publishing:

Expanded, enhanced, evolved.

Primal Carnage: Evolution builds on the bones of what came before, taking dino versus human multiplayer combat to the next level! Take control of an expanded roster of playable dinosaurs, enjoy redesigned gameplay mechanics, plus a wealth of brand new content to sink your teeth into.

Experience lovingly remastered audio and visuals, with remastered textures and lighting at up to 60 frames per second and higher resolution on PlayStation 4 Pro and PlayStation 5.

Hunt humans, slay dinosaurs. Think fast, or you’re extinct!



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/primal-carnage-evolution-now-available

item.title: BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X ‘Story’ trailer, voice cast announced
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

The original cast returns.

Publisher Astrolabe Games and developer 91Act have released the story trailer and announced the voice cast for 2D action roguelite game BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X.

In BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X, the original voice actors from the BlazBlue series return to reprise their roles in an original storyline created by the original scenario writers that introduces five new characters.

The game’s voice cast is as follows:

  • Mercurius (voiced by Chie Matsuura)
    • The leader of the DBS Project and head of the laboratory. Always appears in public wearing a cat-shaped mask. Speaks in a calm tone, making it difficult for anyone to discern their true thoughts.
  • Ti (Dr. T) (voiced by Kenji Nomura)
    • Specialized in physics, he is responsible for research on Mind Strength and Mind Crystals, as well as for maintaining and operating the DBS hardware systems. A serious and reliable individual who holds deep respect for Dr. Mercurius.
  • Cafe (voiced by Takashi Hikida)
    • Specialized in computer science, he is primarily responsible for data analysis (Tactic Tree), crunching numbers, and babysitting the DBS software. Although he appears rather easygoing, he is exceptionally passionate about research.
  • Lime (voiced by Chiaki Takahashi)
    • Specialized in psychology, she is responsible for maintaining the physical condition of each researcher (buff/debuff) and managing the lab’s resources (shop). Gentle and compassionate, she cares deeply for all her colleagues and often looks after them.
  • Fox (voiced by Saki Fujita)
    • Responsible for researching the Sea of Possibility itself and conducting its environmental simulations (Extra Training Ver.α / Ver.β). Usually quiet and reserved, but shows remarkable persistence when it comes to important matters
  • Ragna the Bloodedge (voiced by Tomokazu Sugita)
  • Jin Kisaragi (voiced by Tetsuya Kakihara)
  • Noel Vermillion (voiced by Kanako Kondou)
  • Rachel Alucard (voiced by Kana Ueda)
  • Hakumen (voiced by Tetsuya Kakihara)
  • Bullet (voiced by Toa Yukinari)
  • Kokonoe (voiced by Chie Matsuura)
  • Λ-No.11- (voiced by Kanako Kondou)
  • Hazama (voiced by Yuichi Nakamura)
  • Hibiki Kohaku (voiced by Mitsuhiro Ichiki)
  • Naoto Kurogane (voiced by Nobunaga Shimazaki)
  • Mai Natsume (voiced by Saori Hayami)
  • Es (voiced by Mayuka Nomura)
  • Taokaka (voiced by Chiwa Saitou)
  • Arakune (voiced by Takashi Hikida)
  • Izanami (voiced by Yukana Nogami)
  • Susanoo (voiced by Kenta Miyake)
  • Reki (voiced by Miyuki Satou)
  • Narrator (voiced by Hiro Shimono)

BlazBlue: Entropy Effect is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch on February 12. A demo is available now for PlayStation 5 and Switch.

Watch the trailer below.

Story Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/blazblue-entropy-effect-x-story-trailer-voice-cast-announced
